title: Bob Iger
summary: Robert A. Iger (/ˈaɪɡər/; born February 10, 1951)[2] is an American businessman who is executive chairman, chairman of the board, and former CEO (2005–2020) of The Walt Disney Company. He previously worked as president of ABC Television from 1994 to 1995 and as president/COO of Capital Cities/ABC from 1995 until its acquisition by Disney in 1996. Iger was named president/COO of Disney in 2000 and succeeded Michael Eisner as CEO in 2005.
